entities.name: potter
entities.description: The main character of the story, referred to by his last name 'Potter'. He is being accused of lying and is trying to defend himself. (Excerpt: "YOU'VE GOT IT, POTTER, AND YOU WILL GIVE IT TO ME")

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Another name for the main character 'Potter'. He is laughing and trying to distract the accuser. (Excerpt: "Harry laughed again because he knew it would incense her")

entities.name: prophecy
entities.description: A mysterious object that Potter has in his possession. The accuser is demanding that Potter give it to her. (Excerpt: "Accio Prophecy!")

relationships.description: Potter has the prophecy in his possession, as demanded by the accuser. (Excerpt: "YOU'VE GOT IT, POTTER, AND YOU WILL GIVE IT TO ME")
The accuser is accusing Potter of lying and demanding that he give her the prophecy. (Excerpt: "LIAR!" she shrieked, but he could hear the terror behind the anger now.)
Potter is defending himself against the accuser's accusations. (Excerpt: "Don't waste your breath!" yelled Harry, his eyes screwed up against the pain in his scar.)
